intro: Berkheya armata, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family and is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions. Its leaves are typically narrow and gray-green, adapted to reduce water loss. Berkheya armata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
